answers.answer: I have had 1hours come back high and my 3 hour was normal, but my last preg. I did have gestational and ended up on insulin about a week before my son came(he was 3weeks early)I did try the diet for about 2weeks befor the insulin and it was not working. Now for thyroid-I found a lump on my thyroid and had is drained through out my preg.(2002) and finallyin july of 2003 had the left half removed because it was growing and crushing my vocal cords found out it was cancer. I am now on synthroid 100mg and keepinf a close eye on the right side.Don't know if I was any help.I am keeping my fingers crossed for you.

Thank you missie. It helps just getting any info I can lol. I think everything will turn out ok. This is my 4th baby and I have never had gestational diabetes before so the Dr said it will probably turn out ok this next test. If the thyroid comes back "off" I guess he will explain more then! Thanks!

I got it with my 4th. It runs rampid in my family. After he was born the diabetes went away. Now I just keep tabs on it.  before I had my m/c in nov with our 5th my midwife started me out with a 3hr very early on and wanted to check it monthly.

When Pg with dd, my first glucose test came back a little bit high as did the 4 hour test. I was diagnosed with having a mild glucose intolerance but not gestational diabetes. I controled my sugar through diet.

My first pregnancy (twins) my first test was 139 (borderline) and the 3hour was bad and I ended up with the insulin (btw, I found the diet worst than just shooting the insulin, it hurts less then the fingersticks!). The second pregnancy (singleton) my 1 hour test was much higher (159) but my 3hour was OK. So you never know...
I had 2 family members whos test came back high and the 3 hour test turned out fine. I would worry too much dont stress your self out if anything just watch what you eat.

When I had my glucose screening with this pregnancy, it was 10 points high. I went back for the 3 hour test this past Thursday and every sample was much lower than what they want it to stay under, so all is good. I'm sure you will pass also. Good luck!!

I did the 1 hour test and the 2 hour test and both were over 9 which indicates gd not sure about all these high numbers people talk about in the 100s but in nz I had to test myself 3 times a day and try and keep my blood sugars under 8 it was very hard and just managed to do it most of the time I still had a biggest baby 8lb 9oz at 39 weeks. I had to have a c section after a failed induction but never had labour pains which was a bonus. Good luck at least if you have gd it can be controlled through diet or insulin and usually disapears after the birth.

Thanks everyone for your comments, helps to know others have been through it. I'm going to pray I don't have GD. They say that it raises your risks of developing diabetes in the future, and I don't want to have to worry about that! Again thank you!!

question: Hell ladies. Hope everyone is doing ok. I am currently 26 weeks pregnant. Today I had my glucose screening and it came back 3 points above where it should be. So now I get to go for the 3 hours test, fun fun! Has anyone had their test be a little high and turn out not to be gestational diabetes? And if I do have it what will I have to do during pregnancy, anything different?Another question is, I have PVC's which are worse during pregancy, that's not what I'm writting about though. Also I have been having many many contractions! 13 last night in an hour. I have been through labor before though and knew they weren't "real" labor pains. My Dr. mentioned my thyroid may be "off" being when it's off it can ause PVC's and alos alot of contractions in pregnancy. I can't find ANYTHING on thyroid and pregnancy that really explains enough. All I have read is that it can and has caused early miscarriages. Has anyone experinced thyroid problems in pregnancy as well....if so what were your symptoms and how did they treat it and do you know if I'm at risk for pre-term labor, being I'm having these contractions?Any help would be appreciated ladies. Baby dust to all mommies TTC and sticky baby dust to mommies carrying**********
title: Gstational Diabetes and another question on Thyroid.
